http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: Methods used to spatially locate geological features and exploration, mining and related infrastructure sites. These can be either features directly observed in the field (e.g. site/outcrop descriptions, structural readings, etc.) or obtained from legacy and current documents/datasets (e.g. airphotos, maps, previously published reports, exploration reports, etc.). Each location method has a spatial accuracy that indicates an estimate of the approximate error in the location. Captured geographical locations for geological or mining features are expressed as a set of coordinates (latitude and longitude degrees), with or without an elevation above or below sea level.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#hist.@value: Derived from the GSWA's WAROX table [GSD_REF].[LOCMETHODS] and [MINEDEX].[Site].[MethodType]

https://prez.dev/description.@value: Methods used to spatially locate geological features and exploration, mining and related infrastructure sites. These can be either features directly observed in the field (e.g. site/outcrop descriptions, structural readings, etc.) or obtained from legacy and current documents/datasets (e.g. airphotos, maps, previously published reports, exploration reports, etc.). Each location method has a spatial accuracy that indicates an estimate of the approximate error in the location. Captured geographical locations for geological or mining features are expressed as a set of coordinates (latitude and longitude degrees), with or without an elevation above or below sea level.
